moves.1. e4 e5 2. Nf3 Nc6: The typical first two moves for me. As I play more games, the Ruy Lopez is becoming a bit less common than before.
moves.3. Bc4: Pretty good control of the centre for white.
moves.3... d6: Is this OK? I don't play Nf6 right away in case White does Ng5.
moves.4. h3: I understand that white was trying to prevent Bg4, but this seems like a bit of a wasted move.
moves.4... Nf6: I decided that I should just develop my knight, even if it does allow Ng5.
moves.5... Be6: I didn't want to block any of my bishops with my queen to defend f7, but 6. Bxe6 fxe6 seems like it weakens my kingside a bit.
moves.6... a6: I decide to threaten the bishop, because Bxc6 opens up the b-file for my rook.
moves.7. Bxc6+ bxc6: I now have an open file and good control of the centre.
moves.8. O-O Qd7: I line up for a bishop sacrifice on h3, but the knight of g5 must move first to ensure success.
moves.9... h6: I apply the pressure onto the g5 knight so I can strike at h3.
moves.10. d4: ?? I don't know why this move was done. It just seems to give away a knight.
moves.10... hxg5 11. f3: With rook, bishop and queen all pointed at h3, as well as this weakening move, a successful sacrifice may be easier than I thought!
moves.12. gxh3 Qxh3: I think I have successfully weakened white's kingside.
moves.14. Ke1: White's king is now on its original square, with no living pieces effectively developed.
moves.14... exd4: I decide to take the pawn.
moves.17. e5 Nh5: I'm trying to bring my knight closer to the action.
moves.23. Rd1 Rh2: Cutting off all of the king's escape squares.
moves.24. a4: ?? I guess white thought that I was trying to get his a-pawn. However, this allows a mate in two.
moves.25... Qxf2#: Checkmate! Feel free to comment and give lots of constructive criticism, for this was my 100th game and I wish for the next 100 to be better than the first!
